data.title: Unable to delete files on Windows
data.body: Attempting to delete files through Atom fails with a dialog: But they can be deleted normally from the command line: ```ps C:\Users\smash\src\watcher [master ≡ +1 ~0 -0 !] λ remove-item .\src\worker\windows\foo.md C:\Users\smash\src\watcher [master ≡] λ ``` Or from Explorer, for that matter. It seems to be happening only with files that are not yet tracked in a git repository. /cc @ungb @iolsen @damieng

data.title: Honor macOS "Show scrollbars only when scrolling" setting
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/15442

Previously, we were hiding scrollbars when their height/width was 0. On macOS, however, users can decide to only show scrollbars while scrolling, which causes Atom to detect scrollbars as being invisible during measurements. As a result, we were mistakenly setting the visibility property to `hidden` when this setting was on, thus preventing users from seeing the scrollbar on scroll.

With this pull-request we are:

* Changing the dummy scrollbar components to only become invisible when the content is not scrollable rather than when the scrollbars have zero width or height.
* Moving `DummyScrollbarComponent` back into its own GPU layer. This was a workaround that got added back in bac9922 and it's needed in order for scrollbars to be shown properly when the "Show scrollbars only when scrolling" setting is on.
* Renaming the `is{Horizontal,Vertical}ScrollbarVisible` functions to `canScroll{Horizontally,Vertically}`, to better express their intent. In fact, if the content is scrollable it doesn't necessarily mean that the scrollbar is also visible.

/cc: @nathansobo @Ben3eeE @ungb @lee-dohm

data.title: Atom installer runs for ever but won't install
data.body:
Good afternoon everybody,

So, I already was a Atom user, until it decided just not to open. So, I've tried to reinstall it and just couldn't install it.

I run the set up and it will run for ever and nothing will happen, the gif just keeps going. If I close the set up, the process still stays up, so I have to manually close the process. 
Then, if try to install it again, it fails and generates a [log](https://gist.github.com/doofz/5f2d7676965c66b56c605269b9c9a33a) that says the folder already exists in the %AppData%, I assume it's beaceuse I ran the setup a moment ago.
Then if I try delete the folders, it just won't be deleted unless I restart the machine.

Tried this [solution ](https://discuss.atom.io/t/having-windows-installation-problems/26498?source_topic_id=19833)and it failed

Tried the CClenaer fix, didn't do the trick for me.
And also a couple others, which I don't have the link of them now.

As instructed, I'm filling this issue here hoping to make it work again.

Thanks all!!

data.body:

Table in markdown file does not appear correct.

| a | b | c |

**Actual behavior:** ![screen shot 2017-08-30 at 15 08 57](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/505582/29873862-307daa14-8d95-11e7-86f3-aea733090709.png)

npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.10
git 2.14.1

data.title: Fix rendering of block decorations for invalid markers
data.body:
Fixes #15490

Previously, when a marker became invalid we would delete the corresponding block decoration from the DOM, without however removing it from the `lineTopIndex`. Also, we had a similar issue when decorating a marker that was already invalid: we would account for it in the index without adding it to the DOM.

This pull-request addresses the above problems by ensuring that block decorations are never added for invalid markers. At the same time, the editor component will still keep track of changes on the marker that was decorated, so that it can detect when its validity changes and render it appropriately.

/cc: @nathansobo @Ben3eeE

data.title: uninstaller to remove all leftovers(clean uninstall tool)[FR] - Windows
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Why not have an uninstaller for atom separately since the atom doesn't completely uninstall in windows.
A lot of leftovers are left behind.

Mostly while reinstalling atom. It doesn't install properly due to registry errors(leftovers) and leftovers of the previous installation

I have added few leftovers of uninstallation. one or two may be removed automatically by windows, but most of them isn't removed. Having to tool to clean this automatically would be nice.

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Uninstall atom with windows uninstaller

**Expected behavior:**  The uninstaller should Remove all the unwanted registry entries(Invalid entries) that are not needed when atom is uninstalled

**Actual behavior:** Leftovers are not removed properly which sometimes causes installation problem when we install atom back

**Reproduces how often:** Always

### Versions
Version: All
OS: WIndows 

### Additional Information
Some leftovers that are easily found are
**Folders**
```
C:\Users\{user_name}\.atom
C:\Users\{user_name}\AppData\Local\atom
C:\Users\{user_name}\AppData\Roaming
```
**Registry Entries**
```
HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\*\shell\Atom
HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\.atom
HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Applications\atom.exe
HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Directory\Background\shell\Atom (this creates problems with adding atom to context menu)
HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Directory\shell\Atom
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\*\shell\Atom
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\Applications\atom.exe
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\Directory\Background\shell\Atom
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\Directory\shell\Atom
```

data.title: Refactor install script for linux (install dev channel parallel, use icon themes)
data.body:
### Description of the Change

* Some refactoring on the install script (mainly on the linux part) (1.-3. commit).
* Change the install script to create a separate installation for the dev channel (`atom-dev`) like it is already done for the beta channel (`atom-beta`) (4. commit).
* Change the way icons are handled in the xdg desktop file. This replaces the absolute path used previously with a icon name. The name will then be interpreted by the desktop environment, which in turn selects the icon from a icon theme. This is also how the desktop files in the dep and rpm packages already work. (5. commit).
* Change the install script to copy the application icons (in all resolutions) to the default icon theme. This is required to make to point above work when no alternative icon theme is used or the alternative icon theme does not provide an icon. (5. commit).

### Alternate Designs

None

### Why Should This Be In Core?

* Refactors core code.
* The beta channel is already installed in parallel so the dev channel should be too.
* The new way desktop files are handled is more "linuxy" and preferable as default.

### Benefits

* Cleaner code
* Allows all channels to be installed in parallel.
* Users are able to use alternative icon themes with atom; makes atom more hackable.
* The desktop environment gets to choose between different resolutions.
* Aligns the way the manually installed version behaves with the what is installed from a package.

### Possible Drawbacks

None known

### Applicable Issues

* Perhaps fix #12993 (icon scaling issue).
* Fixes icon behavior mentioned in #14480 (wrong icon path). This is fixed with the 2. commit and with the alternative design from the 5. commit.

data.title: Problem when ReadDirectoryChangesW returns CANCELLED
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages


### Description

When I open a file that resides on our network file server, Atom crashes after about 20 seconds or so. I think I have some clues as to what is causing this, based on system calls monitored through SysInternals Process Monitor. The crash is always immediately following a call to "NtNotifyChangeDirectoryFile". This call is normally used to allow a process to be notified of changes to a folder, but in some environments this functionality is not supported. In our case, the server is returning "CANCELLED," and presumably the result is not being checked by Atom (or whatever component of Atom is issuing the call).

Note that NtNotifyChangeDirectory is probably not the call in the code, so it's more likely coming from something like ReadDirectoryChangesW. I'm not really that familiar with Atom yet, but my best guess is that this is getting called from Node.js. In particular, node/deps/uv/src/win/fs-event.c.  I can confirm that the filters being set in that file match what is being passed to NtNotifyChangeDirectoryFile right before my crash.

Hope this is helpful!

Function docs for reference.
https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa365465(v=vs.85).aspx


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Atom
2. Navigate to a file on NAS that does not support remote monitoring.
3. Keep the page active, and wait for the crash.

**Expected behavior:** The file should remain open with no crash

**Actual behavior:** Atom crashes, offering to close, reopen, or keep open.

**Reproduces how often:** 100% in my environment.

### Versions

Atom 1.19.4 (fresh install)
Atom 1.20.0-beta5 (fresh install)

Windows 8.1

### Additional Information

Our server is a Hitachi HNAS, which is likely to be really hard to replicate. I'm hoping the bug may be self-evident from the code, or perhaps the situation could be reproduced by disabling remote monitoring on a different type of server.

data.title: Scroll to center even if line is already visible
data.body:
### Description of the Change

By removing the check that the `desiredScrollCenter` is not yet between the current `scrollTop` and `scrollBottom`, the scroll is always executed if possible. This is the expected behaviour according to the [docs](https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.19.4/TextEditor#instance-scrollToBufferPosition).

### Alternate Designs

The alternative is not changing it. I don't know why the check was ever added, but I can't think of any possible benefits.

### Why Should This Be In Core?

It's already there.

### Benefits

The behaviour will be as documented. This means that it's possible to center a certain position/range, regardless of the current scroll position.

### Possible Drawbacks

Nothing I can think of.

### Applicable Issues

#11429

data.title: Spammed by GitHub or by atom?
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->
I have just gotten some 800 mails from "stale[bot] notifications@github.com" about issues here in the atom/atom repo.
It contains this text:

```
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
```

And it has **nothing** to do with issues I've in any way participated in, I'm just "watching" this repo.

Is that expected behaviour when watching this repo, or has something strange happened?

data.title: Typing lag and general slow performance after updating to 1.19.4
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [X ] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Experiencing typing lag and general poor performance after updating to 1.19.4. Issues persists even in safe mode and after resetting to factory defaults.

 I was running 1.17.1 with no problems.

A quick GIF showing the issue: http://recordit.co/7VLXuy3urH

I've also created a CPU profile, but am unable to attach here.


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Start typing in an open file and eventually it hangs
2. Scrolling in preferences pane also hangs

**Expected behavior:** Smooth typing

**Actual behavior:** Lagged typing

**Reproduces how often:** Constantly. Makes Atom unusable.

### Versions

Atom    : 1.19.4
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

apm  1.18.4
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.10
git 2.10.1

macOS Sierra
10.12.3

### Additional Information

Any additional information, configuration or data that might be necessary to reproduce the issue.

data.title: Shrink probot-stale window to one year and close in two weeks
data.body:
[probot-stale](https://github.com/probot/stale) has been helping us clean up old issues. We originally implemented it with a very liberal two year stale window to ensure that it worked reliably. Now that probot-stale has [over five thousand issues across all of GitHub under its belt](https://github.com/search?q=commenter%3Aapp%2Fstale&ref=opensearch), we're confident that we can trust it with a more realistic window.

We're shrinking the window where something will be marked stale to one year and if there is no further activity after that, it will be closed in an additional two weeks. All other settings will remain the same.

data.title: It is possible to delete block decorations with core:delete and core:backspace
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    ~* Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode~
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/

    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Selecting text before and after a block decoration and deleting causes the block decoration to be removed but it still takes up space making the lines go out of sync.

I reproduced this using the [preview-inline](https://atom.io/packages/preview-inline) package.

### Steps to Reproduce

![block decoration](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1058982/29829046-ae434f1a-8cde-11e7-95da-64e0abf39b4f.gif)

**Expected behavior:** In Atom 1.18 performing these steps did not delete the block decoration.

**Actual behavior:** Block decoration is removed but still takes up space causing lines to go out of sync.

**Reproduces how often:** 100%

### Versions

Atom 1.19.4

### Additional Information

/cc: @as-cii @nathansobo

data.title: Editor Scrolls Down When Clicking Directly Above Horizontal Scrollbar
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [ X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

The editor view scrolls down/up if you click near the bottom/top of the page. This is particularly annoying because whenever I try to scroll horizontally, the editor scrolls down. Is there anyway to fix this?

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Atom
2. Click right above the horizontal scrollbar
3. The editor window scrolls down

**Expected behavior:** The editor does not scroll

**Actual behavior:** The editor scrolls down

Gif from @rsese https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/15489#issuecomment-325751074

![click-scroll](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/734194/29837029-a65cbfec-8cbc-11e7-9ce4-085329e95390.gif)

**Reproduces how often:** 100% of the time

### Versions 1.19.4

You can get this information from copy and pasting the output of `atom --version` and `apm --version` from the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

### Additional Information

I'm running macOS Sierra version 10.12.6

From @rsese:

Should set `System Preferences > General > Show scroll bars` to `Always`.

Doesn't reproduce in 1.18.0.

    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Clicking on either scrollbar moves the cursor in the editor, which, as a side effect, deselects any text you've selected.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open any text file
2. Select some text
3. Click/drag on either scrollbar and note the position of the cursor

**Expected behavior:** Clicking on a scrollbar has no effect on the cursor's position

**Actual behavior:** Clicking on a scrollbar affects the cursor's position

**Reproduces how often:** 100% of the time

### Versions

```
Atom    : 1.19.4
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

apm  1.18.4
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 3.5.2
git 2.12.2.windows.2
visual studio 2015
```

On Windows 10. This bug was also present in Atom 1.19.3

### Additional Information

It seems others started noticing this problem recently as well:
* https://discuss.atom.io/t/clicking-on-scrollbar-moves-cursor-in-the-editor-erratically/46732
* https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3284#issuecomment-324958746

data.title: Always honor scroll intent on mousewheel
data.body:
Fixes #15467

This pull-request introduces a change in the way we respond to mousewheel events. In particular, if `-1 < delta * scrollSensitivity < 1`, we will scroll up or down by 1 in an attempt to honor the user's scroll intent.

/cc: @iolsen @lee-dohm @ungb @nathansobo

data.title: Move highlight decorations outside of tiles
data.body:
As a consequence of https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15378, we are now able to render highlight decorations in a separate div, as opposed to having an highlight container for each tile.

Code-wise this is much simpler, because highlights spanning multiple tiles can be represented via a single region and don't need to be split across the tiles they span anymore. As a byproduct, performance should improve as well, because the number of nodes that need to be managed should decrease significantly.

This also fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/15449 (and other similar rendering artifacts), because highlight decoration DOM nodes won't need to move between tiles anymore when their position changes.

/cc: @nathansobo @t9md

data.title: Uninstalling any package failed
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Hi !
Since i upgraded my atom to 1.9.3, I have the following error when I try to uninstall any package.
This is minor because the package is finally removed and disappears from the package list if I restart atom and it seems to not appear when I disable the package before.

```
/usr/share/atom/resources/app/apm/lib/auth.js:22
      return keytar.findPassword(tokenName).then(function(token) {
                                           ^

TypeError: Cannot read property 'then' of undefined
    at Object.getToken (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/apm/lib/auth.js:22:44)
    at Uninstall.module.exports.Uninstall.registerUninstall (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/apm/lib/uninstall.js:58:19)
    at iterate (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/apm/node_modules/async/lib/async.js:134:13)
    at Object.async.eachSeries (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/apm/node_modules/async/lib/async.js:150:9)
    at Uninstall.module.exports.Uninstall.run (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/apm/lib/uninstall.js:124:20)
    at Object.run (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/apm/lib/apm-cli.js:227:32)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/apm/lib/cli.js:8:7)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/apm/lib/cli.js:12:4)
    at Module._compile (module.js:570:32)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:579:10)
```

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to Settings/Packages
2. Uninstall a package without disabling it before by clicking "Uninstall"

**Expected behavior:** 
Package removed with success

**Actual behavior:** 
Package removed but still in the package list, and the error in the description appears.

**Reproduces how often:** 
100%

### Versions
On Debian Jessie 8.9

Atom --version:
Atom    : 1.19.3
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

apm --version:
apm  1.18.4
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.9
git 2.1.4

Thanks you.

data.title: Slow install from zip/rar
data.body: Slow install from zip/rar caused by having thousands of small files to be unpacked. Suggested fix consolidate files to reduce file count. Currently ~33,000 files in ~10,800 folders for 516MB

data.title: Atom scrolls even when not focused
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

*  Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
   * [x] Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
   * [x] Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
   * [x] Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
   * [x] Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
   * [x] Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

The text-editor window does not seem to lose focus on alt-tabbing in Fedora 26, Gnome 3.24. This seems to be a regression introduced in Atom 1.19.0 (reproducible in 1.19.4). This was once fixed in https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/12591 but the issue reappeared with the newest Atom version.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Have a document open in Atom, notice the position of the scroll bar
2. Alt+Tab to a window over Atom
3. Scroll down a lot
4. Alt+Tab back to Atom
5. Scroll down

**Expected behavior:**
The editor window scrolls down a bit

**Actual behavior:**
The editor windows scrolls by the sum of the scroll amounts in step 3. + 5.

**Reproduces how often:**
100%

### Versions
OS: Fedora 26

`atom --version`
Atom    : 1.19.4
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

`gnome-shell --version`
GNOME Shell 3.24.3

data.title: uninstaller to remove all leftovers(clean uninstall tool)[FR] - Windows
data.body:
#### Feature Request

Why not have an uninstaller for atom separately since the atom doesn't completely uninstall in windows.
A lot of leftovers are left behind.

Mostly while reinstalling atom. It doesn't install properly due to registry errors(leftovers) and leftovers of the previous installation
